Behavior Cloning for Self-Driving Car
Overview
How can we control a car by only camera? The idea of behavior cloning is to replicate the driving performance of human by using machine learning whose model uses the camera data as feature(input) and the steering angle as label(output).
Obviously, deep learning is the first model that could be used for this task.　The deep learning model I used is almost same as NVIDIA's self-driving car, 5 convolutional layers and 4 full connected layers. Plus, I did data augmentation and hyper parameter tuning, which is the hardest part of deep learning work, I believe.
This project was part of the Udacity's Self-driving Engineer course. While it was super fun to let my model run on simultaion, there are tons of things to achieve better performance of deep learning model. Term : 2017.03 (1 week)
Software : python (sklearn, tensorflow, keras, pandas, numpy)
Problems
How to train the machine learning model that successfully run on the simulator?
Using the three cameras (assuming the dash cam) as input, the objective of this project is to predict the steering angle so that the car does not deviate from the course. The challenging part is where curve is sharp and the side lane is missing. Data augmentaion, data preprocessing and deep learning model are tweaked trial and error.
The velocity control is done by simple PI controller.
Solution
The model I used for this task is the NVIDIA's self-driving car model which has 5 convolutional layers and 4 full connected layers. This ended up about 3 million parameter to my case.
The three images from cameras are simply augmented by flipping. The preprocess is just simple gray scale converstion + cropping. I spent a while for trial and error with various preprocess such as blurring, canny edge detection, contrast adjustment, but the simple gray works best for now.
Result
One of the result is shown in the right movie. It successfully completes one lap of the course. Obviously, this simulation uses new data (test data), so this can adapt to new dataset of this course.
What if the course is changed? The idea of behavior cloning requires different dataset to secure the driving perfomrance. However, this tranied model could be helpful when transfer learning is used for new course. There is one more challenging different track in Udacity's simulator where it has uphill and downhills. This 2nd course is the one in which even human feels difficulties to control the car. I will try it later on.
Prius Challenge
Overview
Prius Challenge was the racing competition about maximizing mpg for Prius by data-driven strategy. This involves both data science(theory) and real driving skills(practice). I applied both two different machine learning approaches to identify the best strategy to achieve higher mpg. The analysis revealed, for example, where to use 'neutral'/'drive' or 'EVmode(on/off)'. As a result, our team got the award of 'Best MPG by Machine Learning'! Plus, we achieved 83mpg(w/o penalties), while Toyota dream team did 86mpg. Yeah, we were so close and I can say data-driven approach worked! This competition was held at Sonoma Raceway by Toyota Research Institute in Mar 3rd, 2017. Our team was composed of me(data scientist) and 4 other members of great drivers!
Problems
Q1. How do we identify best strategy to maximize mpg? Given the dataset, it is required to identify how use inputs (throttle, brake, gear and EV-mode)
Q2. How does data scientist deliver the strategy to drivers? This is not only data analytics but also teamwork. Delivering the result to driver is key part.
(Sonoma Raceway has tough uphill and downhill; 47[m] height. This makes this challenge hard.)
Solution
1. Comparison between high and low performance
Applying clustering technique to gps information, I have divided the race track into 150 pieces. Then, I visualized the average and variance of the 4 inputs(gear, brake, throttle, ev-mode) using high-performance dataset (top 30% mpg data) and low-performance dataset (Bottom 30% mpg data). This visualization helps driver to undersntand the strategy of how they use 4 inputs to get higher mpg.
2. Understanding remarkable point
Using 600 features (4inputs x 150 locations) and mpg data as the label, supervised learning is applied. Then, the feature importance is applied to identify the important inputs which highly affect mpg. In other words, they are the remakable points that drivers specially consider.
Result
It was an honor to recieve the prize of "Best MPG by Machine Learning" out of 20 teams! Our data-driven strategy was truly acknowledged by Toyota Research Institute. We were fortunate to get the picture with the chairman of Toyota Motor Corp. and CEO of TRI.
As for competition result, we achieved 83mpg on average for 9 laps(42:29). We did great job! We were so close to Toyota dream team(86mpg) who are the most knowledable people about Prius. Overall result was 4th position among 20 teams because we had unfortunate penalties.
Our team got ABC7 news' attention. My name was on TV! Here is the source.
I am looking forward to joining to next year's autonomous driving Prius Challenge'18.
Mining Muscle Use Data for Fatigue Reduction in IndyCar
Overview
This research discusses how data analytics on muscle use in extreme racing conditions can be conducted to find actionable insights for the driver One of the important insights is how to minimize driver’s muscle fatigue during a race, because IndyCar has regulations forbidding the use of power steering. This research tackles two technological challenges: 1. data validation on noisy signal obtained from wearable device in extreme condition, 2. data cultivation to find actionable insights for the driver from heterogeneous racing data. First, we propose a data quality assessment technique, enabling the judgment of whether data is reliable or not. This qualitative analysis revealed that the data validation method works 99.5% accuracy to classify data as reliable or not. Second, we propose a data visualization tool based on unsupervised learning that enables the driver or mechanics to discover useful feedback. We identified and demonstrated several actionable insights, e.g., identifying potential relaxation points.
Term : 2016.03 - 2016.10
Software : python (sklearn, tensorflow, keras, pandas, numpy), html/js(bootstrap, Grafana, bokeh.js, Mapbox, node.js), InfluxDB
Problems
The driver's challenge and data science's challenges are shown in the right figure.

Yeah, this may sound the straightforward problem statement though, it was not easy to setup this problem indeed. First, I had f2f conversation with Tony Kanaan to discuss his real challenges. (design thinking process) While most of them were hard to solve due to the lack of the dataset, some sounded feasible to me. Then, once I started data analytics and had discussion with various people, I realized the necessity of the data validation process. Like this project, innovation works are occasionally hard to define job contents at first. To me, the hard challenges of this projects are 1. clarifying the problem statement and 2. collecting the unique dataset.
Solution
The idea of the data validation is that the actual sensor data is considered as unreliable data if the difference betweeen actual and predicted value are big. The prediction model uses car-telemetry data as features and predict the EMG value. This aims for prediction model to avoid the bad effect of noisy EMG values.
Data cultivation uses the unsupervised learning for driver or mechanics to understand tremendous data in more intuitive way.
In additino to data analytics, I also created data visualization WebUI for them. Data validation is shown in real-time dashboard and data cultivation is shown in post analytics dashboard.
Result
The data validation model has 99.48% accuracy to classify whether the EMG sensor data is reliable or unreliable. Yeah, it has good performance. (Please see the details on my paper.)
The data cultivation identified the locations where driver tends to have unstable muscle use and where driver can take rest more. This may be feedback for the driver to avoid muscle cramp.
I presented this research in MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference and NTT R&D Forum '17. The best part is I got autograph of Tony Kanaan. :D
Failsafe for Drone System : Nonlinear System Analytics and Contorl for Trirotor Drone system
Overview
What if a drone loses one control input by accident while flying? Since a ordinal drone system has 4 inputs, this research tackles the control problem of 3 inputs drone model, trirotor.
First, this research revealed the minimal number of inputs for hovering control from the perspective of nonlinear control system theory. The model analysis reveals that hovering control is impossible for any three-inputs drone system through the argument of Locally Asymptotically Stabilizability(LAS).
Second, this research proposed a nonlinear controller for an underactuated UAV having three inputs to realize “circle motion”, the motion that the attitude of UAV points to the center of circle while the center of mass moves on a circle orbit. The proposed method is redesigning the time-varying output zeroing controller discretely. This method allows output functions to be kept zero even though output functions are changed.
Problems
Q1. What is the limitation in controlling both position and attitude in 3D (SE(3)) ?
There are 6 states (12 states including velocity) that needs to be controlled for hovering. How many inputs are the minimum number of the control inputs for hovering control? Can this be revealed by mathematical proof?

Q2. What control can be done with only 3 inputs? Even with the 3 inputs, there must be meaningful motion that the nonlinear control can achieve such as circle motion mentioned above. How do we design the nonlinear controller to realize this motion with only 3 inputs.
Solution
1. Nonlinear System Analytics for input number revealation
Previously, M.Ishikawa and M.Sampei revealed a necessary condition for LAS that is “A system is not feedback stabilizable if the number of inputs is less than the dimension of the equilibria submanifold.” In order to apply this theorem to the generic model of drone system, I identified the dimension of the equlibria submanifold of it by using the general mathematical formulation of drone system.
2. Nonlinear Control Strategy for circle motion
The left figure shows the strategy for the circle motion control. First, the system focuses on controlling the (x,y,z) position control by Output Zeroing Control. Second, once it is completed, the remaining dynamics (Zero Dynamics) mainly causes instability to yaw angle. The idea to control yaw angle is changing the time-variant output function with maintaining the (x,y,z) position. In other words, this method enables to control Zero Dynamics.
Result
1. The following control limitation is proved.
Theorem : "Assume that UAV is composed of only a rigid body and propellers, then it is impossible to locally asymptotically stabilize a generic UAV model having less than three rotors inputs via continuous state feedback." The details can be found on my paper (IFAC'11) .
2. Circle Motion Control with only three inputs.
The result of the numerical simulation is shown on right movie. As you can see, first the (x,y,z) position control is realized. Second, changing the yaw-angle with maintaining the (x,y,z) position is realized. The details can be found on my paper (CDC'13) .
Semi-Hovering Control for Monorotor using Discrete Output Zeroing
Overview
Do you know Take-copter (figure below)? This tool is used in one of the most famous SF animation in Japan, Doraemon. Yes, it is impossible to flying without counter rotation of the body due to law of action and reaction. In reality, toys usually has two rotor to cancel this effect. Yeah, it sounds definitely impossible to control hovering motion by only one input.

This research proposes a nonlinear controller realizing periodic motion to MonoRotor type flying robot having no equilibrium point. The control target is semi-hovering; a motion that passes a desired non-equilibrium point at which position and attitude stop periodically. In order to achieve this control objective, we propose discontinuous and time-varying output zeroing controller which ends up controlling Zero Dynamics. The numerical simulation and stability analysis show the validity of the suggesting controller design method.
Problems
The Monorotor system has structural underactuation, since the number of input is less than the number of states. (two states : posture and height, one input : single rotor) In addition, Monorotor robot does not own the equilibrium point. Because of these properties, the only way to realize the meaningful motion is semi-hovering, which is a periodic motion that passes at the desired non-equilibrium point in each cycle. Thus, this control objective requires Zero Dynamics to be controlled. The main contribution of this research is the controller design that results in controlling Zero Dynamics.
Solution
Discrete Output Zeroing The strategy to realize semi-hovering has the following two steps. 1st step controls posture, then 2nd step controls height. The key idea is that the 2nd step, height control, needs to be done with maintaining 1st step goal. When designing output zeroing control to control posture, one parameter is free parameter which is the frequency of the rotor. Changing the frequency results in different height. Wisely changing the free parameter, frequency, enables to control height! In this case, height becomes zero dynamics when 1st step is realized. Thus, this method can control zero dynamics discretely.
Result
Successful Semi-hovering in Simulation In this research, a new way to design time-varying non-linear controller that realize periodic motion is proposed. This method also suggests a way to control Zero Dynamics for Monorotor type flying robot. Numerical simulation verified the validity of the suggesting controller, achieving semi-hovering motion successfully. The details can be found on my paper (SICE'11) .
(What if the rotation frequency corresponds to the fps of the video capturing in the world of Doraemon... Yeah, their world also obeys the law of physics. :D)
jumping motion control using unstable Zero Dynamics for Acrobot
Overview
Acrobot is two-link manipulator which has only one input (motor) between these links. This system is called 'underactuated system', because the number of input is less than the number of states. This research aims for jumping and landing motion control for Acrobot.
Problems
Q. How do we control Acrobot without using linear approximation? While linear approximation control works in limited conditions, nonlinear controller gives more flexible and stable performance. Especially, this is very interesting research topic, as the controller utilizes 'unstable' zero dynamics for jumping and 'stable' zero dynamics for landing phase.
Solution
As a control strategy, I defined 5 different phase. 1. transition phase aims for changing posture for jumping 2. jumping phase aims for jumping off from ground 3. flying phase aims for changin posture for landing phase 4. impact phase provides strong external force. 5. landing phase aims for stabilizing acrobot again. At phase 1 and 5, controller uses output zeroing whose output fuction is based on angular momentum. Using this method makes Zero Dynamics stable. At phase 2, controller uses output zeroing whose output fuction is based on the direction of flying path. Using this method makes Zero Dynamics unstable.
Result
In simulation, it successfully goes through five different phases and suceeded in flying and landing.
In experiment, both flying phase and landing phase went well. In this experiment, we used the air table to realize the half gravity situation. This air table has a bunch of tiny holes which blow compressed air to make Acrobot levitate from the board. These effect of air may not be small enough to neglect. Thus, more robust controller would be needed. my paper (SICE'11) .
Yasu's DIY Factory : Homemade Speaker
Behind Story
What is the things to which you feel affection? Do you have something that you are using for more than 20 years?
I acknoledge that I am a heavy user of Amazon. It is extremely time/cost effective way to obtain what I need though, it is also very easy to dispose of them. What a great era of mass production and mass consumption.
However, I also feel it important to keep meaningful things to my life. If something you own reminds of very important memory in your life, they may be special for you and you may feel affection to it.
DIY is great hobby, which my father taught me (even through DNA, I guess). Since I was a young kid, I made every furnitures, toys... They are still in my parents house and they remind me of my childhood. DIY is not always cost effective and definitely not time effective way. But they tend to last long and give me special feeling, affection.
My lifelong speaker, maybe
This time, I made speaker, the simple model of bass reflex. Making speaker means here is to design a box to maximize the performance of a speaker unit. This work was great and I still love them: design, texture and, of course, the sound quality. The color and speaker unit have been 'aged' and will be classical until I die. :D Now, I need to protect them from my baby's poking. But even if it is broken by accident, I am sure I will repair them and get more affection to it.
The steps
Here is the summary of the steps
  1. Decide the speaker unit
    2. Depending on the limitation of your space and the requirement of sound quality and your budget, you may want to decide the speaker unit first. If needed, tweeter should be added for better performance for high frequency sound. In Japanese, this place is very helpful. You may want to Akihabara to get feedback from the most knowledgable people. Koizumi Musen
  2. Design the box
    3. A bass reflex system (also known as a ported, vented box or reflex port) is a type of loudspeaker enclosure that uses a port (hole) or vent cut into the cabinet and a section of tubing or pipe affixed to the port. (from wikipedia) Thus, the size of the enclosure(bos), the hole affect the quality of the sound. This should be designed depending on the specification of the speaker unit that you chose. In Japanese, this site may help to design the enclosure(box).
  3. Go to home center and get materials
    4. There are various woods. Every woods have different characteristics. Stiff is said to be better, but I chose the wood by the texture and my budget. You may want to pay attention to the direction of the grain. Do not forget to get the acoustical material, which should be attached to insider of the speaker. Plus, you need to get wiring cable and terminal for it.
  4. Assemble the materials and paint
    5. You just need to assemble them. I am not writing details here, but just create whatever you want. If you make any mistake, that is part of your memory and it will become the reason why you feel affection, maybe.
  5. Test(aging)
    6. Some people talk about aging. To me, it sounds like urban legend... The idea of the aging is that the more you use the speaker, the better quality sound you can experience. Some people play music for several days, which makes the speaker unit adapts the design of the enclosure you designed.
    However, I personally do not think my sense of hearing quality is good enough to distinguish very slight but important difference of music...
Automatic Loose Ball Detection by ball trajectory analytics
Overview
I have played basketball since I was 6 years old. As I love it, I joined to MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Hackathon hosted by ESPN in Mar.2017. The theme of the hackathon was "Measure the unmeasureable in basketball" such as teamwork, mentality, leadership and heart. Yeah, sounds very tough. This is specifically hard task as a data science task, because there are no ground truth of these factors...
For this hackathon, I decided to focus on 'loose ball detection'. In basketball, loose ball is the moment audience can fell player's fighting spirits. Not only that, chasing loose ball has chance to 1. excite audience, 2. inspire teammates and 3. change momentum of the game.
Conventionally in the given dataset by ESPN (as far as I thoroughly surveyed), the loose ball has not been recorded unless it is related to foul. Thus, finding loose ball automatically would be helpful to understand player's latent power of mentality.
Term : 1~2days
Software : python(pandas, numpy), html/js(bokeh.js)
Problems
Q. How is it possible to detect loose ball? Chasing loose ball could be one of the important actions to tell player's fighting spirits. However, the loose ball is not recorded in stats. Moreover, there may not be well-defined definition of loose ball in literature.
The given dataset includes the both ball and players trajectory. Thus, the challenge is how to define the loose ball in mathematical formulation.
Solution
The left figure desribes my approach to detect loose ball. Based on observational definittion, the mathematical formulation was set up. If the trajectory data satisfies all of the conditions at certain moment, then the moment can be the time somebody is chasing loose ball.
Now, this is a merely heuristic approach. Once the labeled data of loose ball is available, I should apply the supervised learning appoach. Maybe, this is typical type of deep learning task!
Result
Based on the above rule-based approach, the right movie shows one of the example of the loose ball. Here, you can see two of each team members chase the ball.
There are 180+ applicants to this hackathon, and I was chosen for the 40 participants! Unfortunately, I could not make it to finalist this time. (First time to miss the award in hackathon!) It looked like the host, ESPN, wanted to know more creative idea, not cool software implementation. I learned that competing sports industry is very hard unless you have really deep knowledge about that sports. Even though my hobby is basketball, my creativity about basketball may not be enough to satisfy ESPN.
Smart Fleet Management System using IoT-driven Battery Prediction
Overview
I participated in Mercedes Benz Hackathon at Silicon Valley '16 as a data scientist. The challenge was to create the innovative fleet management system within 24 hours. I worked with people whom I met for the first time on site and successfully delivered the smart fleet management PoC. We decided to implement the future vision of fleet management based on the core battery prediction functionality. This prediction would be accurately conducted by machine leanring using IoT data and CAN data. Using this prediction, we proposed the new smart fleet system with 1. smart route planning, 2. real-time navigation feedback.
The result of the hackathon was 2nd prize among 120+ applicants. The juries judged the quality of both idea and implementation.
Term : 2016.11 (24 hours)
Software : python (sklearn, pandas, numpy), html/js(angular JS, Grafana, Mapbox), InfluxDB
Problems
Q. How to improve EV's battery prediction accuracy?
In general, stopping by charging stations is a loss in fleet management businesses. However, when planning the route, it looks like hard to predict battery consumption. (Based on my experience using Nissan Leaf for more than one year, the battery prediction functionality does not count the characteristics of road and can not accurately predict battery consumption.) I think this is because many factors affect EV's battery performance such as the weight of the cargo, weather, temperature, route (gradient of terrain, traffic), time and how you drive. What if all of these factors are available through IoT sensors? The prediction performance should be dramatically improved!
Q. If the system can predict EV's battery consumption more accurately, what does the future fleet management for delivering system look like? There are many use cases using battery prediction though, we decided to focus on two functions : 1. smart route planning, 2. real-time navigation feedback.
Solution
1. Smart Route Planning
Every car has different battery capacity and remaining battery. Each of drivers has different driving behavior. Depending on the combination of the driver and the car, the best routing path may differ. Some routes require the driver to drop by charging station. Some routes should be the most energy efficient route to avoid dropping by charging station. Some routes should be the fastest route due to Amazon Prime. Using battery prediction, the combination of car, driver and route can be optimally matched.
2. Real-time Navigation Feedback
The fleet manager should want to have the real-time monitoring tool to see each driver's performance. This tool visualizes the battery prediction and current value. While some driver follows original planning of the battery use, the other drivers may not be able to follow it. In this case, fleet manager can tell driver to change driver behavior or go to the charging station during lunch time.
Result
Our team, FleetWise, won the 2nd prize in this hackathon. It was very nice to meet new people, discuss the challenges in this industry and think about something new in the IoT and Automotice Era.
In future, once tremendous data of CAN data and IoT data are collected, we can create the knowledge base of the fuel consumption map. Like the traffic information is attributed to edges of road network, I think the battery consumption level can be added to the edges too. Using this knowledge base, my leaf can be wiser too. :D
Photo : I was fortunate to take a photo with Arwed Niestroj, the CEO of Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America.
